marketNews.title: Snips Recap 2023: Normalization of Commodity Prices and Inflation
marketNews.content: Here are the Important Events that Occurred Throughout 2023. The year 2023 was marked by the normalization of commodity prices from the 2022 supercycle, continued high global interest rates, declining inflation, and increasing geopolitical tensions. Domestically, the continued economic recovery to pre-pandemic levels provided balance to the declining trade balance so that economic growth was still maintained at the 5% level. Let's review the series of important events in 2023! JANUARY 17: China's GDP grew by +3% during 2022, lower than the target of +5.5%. 19: Bank Indonesia raised the BI7DRRR by 25 bps to 5.75%. FEBRUARY 2: The Fed raised the benchmark interest rate by 25 bps to the range of 4.5-4.75%. 6: Indonesia's GDP grew by +5.31% in 2022, the highest since 2013. MARCH 10: Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) was declared collapsed and closed by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. 20: UBS acquired Credit Suisse to prevent the collapse of the global banking system. 24: The Fed raised the benchmark interest rate by 25 bps to the level of 4.75-5%. APRIL 3: OPEC+ reduced oil production by 1.16 million barrels/day starting from May 2023 until the end of 2023. 28: US Economy only grew by +1.1% YoY in 1Q23, the weakest since 2Q22. MAY 4: The Fed raised the benchmark interest rate by +25 bps to the range of 5-5.25%. 15: BPS recorded that Indonesia's trade balance was in surplus by 3.94 billion US dollars in April 2023. 29: Increase in the US debt ceiling to avoid potential default. JUNE 12: IDX officially implemented the special monitoring board. 13: China's central bank cut interest rates by 10 bps to 1.9%, the first since Aug 2022. 15: The Fed held the benchmark interest rate steady in the range of 5-5.25%. 19: Government increased the price limit for VAT-free subsidized housing. JULY 13: US inflation fell to the 3% YoY level in June 2023, the lowest since March 2021. 21: Realization of investment in Indonesia 2Q23 grew by +6.3% QoQ and +15.7% YoY to Rp349.8 trillion. 27: The Fed raised the benchmark interest rate to the range of 5.25-5.50%. AUGUST 2: OJK officially issued carbon trading regulations. 7: Indonesia's GDP grew by +3.86% QoQ and +5.17% YoY in 2Q23. 22: The Ministry of ESDM revised the formula for calculating the Reference Coal Price (HBA) again. 24: BI officially issued Bank Indonesia Rupiah Securities (SRBI). SEPTEMBER 18: OJK officially issued a carbon exchange business license to the IDX. 21: Groundbreaking for the construction of the Nusantara Hotel in IKN with a capital of Rp20 trillion. 26: Launch of the carbon exchange in Indonesia. 27: The practice of social commerce was officially banned in Indonesia. E-commerce is also prohibited from selling imported products priced under 100 US dollars. OCTOBER 2: Indonesian inflation in September 2023 dropped significantly to the 2.28% YoY level, mainly influenced by the high base effect. 9: Oil prices strengthened by +2.9% to 86.9 US dollars per barrel, driven by concerns over conflict escalation in the Middle East. 18: China's GDP grew by +1.3% QoQ and +4.9% YoY in 3Q23. 19: BI decided to raise the BI7DRR to 6%, exceeding consensus expectations. NOVEMBER 2: As of 9M23, foreign tourist arrivals to Indonesia rose by +143.41% YoY to 8.51 million. 6: Indonesia's GDP grew by +1.6% QoQ and +4.94% YoY in 3Q23. 13: Moody's downgraded the US credit rating outlook from 'stable' to 'negative'. 28: The 2024 election campaign officially began, and will last for 75 days until February 10, 2024. DECEMBER 1: OPEC+ agreed on a voluntary production cut of 2.2 million barrels per day. 4: Gold price reached an all-time high of 2,148 US dollars per ounce in intraday trading. 14: The Fed held the benchmark interest rate steady in the range of 5.25-5.5% and indicated 3 rate cuts in 2024.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Dominates Market Cap, BREN Briefly Overtook in Early December
tickerNews.content: $BBCA still holds the largest market capitalization with a value of 1,144 trillion rupiah. What is interesting is that BBCA's dominance as the top market cap was briefly shifted on December 8, 2023, by the newcomer emitter, Barito Renewables Energy ($BREN).
